summary: This document is a collection of internal Bureau of Prisons memoranda from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, detailing the response to an apparent suicide attempt by inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019. The reports describe finding Epstein with a makeshift noose, his medical state, his placement on suicide watch, and his subsequent allegations that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, had tried to kill and extort him.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found with an orange cloth around his neck in his cell, was placed on suicide watch, and later alleged his cellmate tried to kill and extort him.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who reported the incident to guards, was secured during the response, and was later accused by Epstein of attempted murder and extortion.

persons.name: M. Thomas
persons.context: A staff member who assisted in carrying Epstein to the HA-Unit on a stretcher after the incident.

connections.description: Were housed together in cell Z05-124LAD. Epstein later accused Tartaglione of attempting to kill him and extort money from him.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt at MCC
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with an orange homemade cloth around his neck, appearing unresponsive. Staff intervened, removed the noose, and transported him to the HA-Unit for suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Alleges Extortion and Murder Attempt by Cellmate
events.description: After becoming responsive, Epstein told staff he believed his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, had tried to kill him and had been attempting to extort money from him for a week, threatening to beat him up if he didn't pay.

events.title: Epstein's Legal Visit
events.description: Epstein stated he returned from a legal visit at approximately 8:00 PM on the evening before the incident.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found with an orange homemade cloth noose around his neck in his MCC cell on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 a.m.
Epstein later alleged to prison staff that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, had tried to kill him and had been extorting him with threats of violence for a week.
Epstein claimed he had only informed his attorney about the threats from Tartaglione, not prison staff, because he believed officers would not report an assault due to his charges.
Medical examination revealed a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of Epstein's neck with friction marks, and a small erythema on his left knee.
Multiple staff memos provide consistent accounts of the initial response but contain Epstein's contradictory statements about his awareness during the event.
